intro: Myristica malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar nut or Malabar pepper, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, ellipsoid-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. The plant produces a dark brown, oily resin known as malabar nut oil, which is used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct aromatic scent. The tree typically grows up to 10 meters tall and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
